lines.content: What I have used AI for
1. I write down my implementation of the question, and then ask the AI model design questions about the code
2. For example, the first time I wrote my Orion class it was long winding and not very modular
3. So, I asked Claude Sonnet for suggestions on how to improve it, and it told me I should follow the "Single Responsibility principle"
4. I then searched about it on Google (and then read https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Single-responsibility_principle), and decided to refactor my code to fix it.
5. Used AI to understand file I/O in Java and use for my function (after giving it pseudocode)
### Other Minor Things I used it for
1. Understanding various Java features I had forgotten / not known (Overriding rules learnt in CS2030s, packages)

DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd MMM yyyy HH:mm");
* A simple data carrier class that holds the details of a deadline.

*

This class is used to transfer deadline information, including
* the task's description and due date, between different parts of the
* program. The fields are private and final, ensuring that the data
* is immutable once an instance of the class is created.

*

The class provides getter methods for accessing the deadline details.
* Constructs a DeadlineDetails object with the specified description
* @param description a brief description of the task with a deadline
* @param by the due date and time of the deadline
* Returns the description of the deadline task.
* @return the description of the deadline task
* Returns the due date and time of the deadline.
* @return the due date and time of the deadline

* A simple data carrier class that holds the details of an event.

*

This class is used to transfer event information, including
* the event's description, start time, and end time, between different
* parts of the program. The fields are private and final, ensuring
* that the data is immutable once an instance of the class is created.

*

The class provides getter methods for accessing the event details.
* Constructs an EventDetails object with the specified description,
* @param description a brief description of the event
* @param from the start time of the event
* @param to the end time of the event
